questions.question: What happens to the manometric head when the discharge of a centrifugal pump increases?

explanations.a: Generally, head decreases as discharge increases due to pump characteristics.
explanations.b: Correct! Usually, manometric head decreases with increase in discharge.
explanations.c: Head varies with discharge, so it doesn't remain constant.
explanations.d: Head does not become zero unless pump stops.

questions.question: Which factor primarily affects the efficiency of a centrifugal pump?

explanations.a: Suction pressure alone does not determine efficiency.
explanations.b: Correct! Efficiency depends on discharge, head, and input power.
explanations.c: Material affects durability but not efficiency directly.
explanations.d: Color has no effect on efficiency.

questions.question: If the input power to the pump is 2 kW and the output power is 1.5 kW, what is the efficiency?
Which of the following is NOT a part of the centrifugal pump?

explanations.a: Impeller is a key part of the pump.
explanations.c: Correct! Piston is part of reciprocating pumps, not centrifugal pumps.

questions.question: What is the main reason for efficiency loss in a centrifugal pump?

explanations.a: Correct! Friction, turbulence, and hydraulic losses reduce efficiency.
explanations.c: Pipe shape has minor effect compared to losses inside pump.
explanations.d: Valve type affects flow but is not main cause of efficiency loss.
